CHAT.comment: Hesitation phenomena have not been accurately transcribed in this data

u.a: INV , MOT and CHI enter the room . MOT leads CHI in by the hand and immediately starts looking through her bag
INV explains warm-up task to MOT and then leaves the room
MOT rearranges things in her bag
apparently something has spilled inside of MOT's bag
CHI takes a step away from MOT
CHI looks up at the table
CHI walks back over near MOT
view of CHI is blocked by MOT
CHI starts to walk around near MOT
MOT re-arranges her bag and then zips it shut
MOT sits on the floor and pulls down CHI's pants
MOT changes CHI diaper while CHI stands
CHI stands next to MOT and leans on chair
MOT puts her bag on a chair
MOT looks at CHI who is holding up the football
<bef> MOT examines the toy car . MOT looks up at CHI
CHI swings the ball and then drops it behind him hitting the waste basket
MOT reacts to the bang of the ball hitting the waste basket
MOT sits in the chair and watches CHI
CHI walks over to the table looking around the room
CHI points to something out of camera view
MOT turns to look at where CHI pointed to
MOT sits on the floor and shows CHI the picture book
CHI stands next to MOT to look at the book with her
CHI picks the toy car up
MOT looks at the picture book
MOT points to a picture of a truck in the picture book
MOT points to the picture in the book
CHI tries to turn the pages in the book
MOT shows CHI the picture in the book
MOT turns the pages in the book
MOT points to a picture in the book
MOT points to the front of the book
CHI points to the picture of the ball on the cover of the book
MOT points to another picture on the cover of the book
MOT holds the open book in front of CHI and points to the page
<bef> CHI plays with the toy car . CHI drops the toy car and stands
MOT continues to turn pages in the book
MOT looks at the table and then turns to look at CHI
CHI points to the jack+in+the+box and looks at MOT for help
MOT sings along with the jack+in+the+box
CHI puts the clown back down into the box
MOT helps CHI close the box
CHI tries to push the clown back in the box
MOT pushes the clown in the box
CHI tries to wind the jack+in+the+box
MOT helps CHI wind the jack+in+the+box up
MOT leans into CHI and looks at CHI
CHI looks at the rubber duck
MOT puts her hand over CHI hand and turns the handle with CHI until the clown pops out
CHI pushes the clown down once and then starts to squeeze the rubber duck again

INV enters the room at 09:45:20 to explain Small Scale Activity to MOT then leaves the room while Small Scale Activity takes place . INV re-enters at 09:51:10 and explains the Forbidden Object task to MOT and has her sit next to CHI at the table . INV puts away the toy and gives CHI the squeeze toy to hold
MOT tries to comfort CHI who is upset with the presence of INV
INV puts the object on the table and sets it into motion
CHI is shy and close to tears as Investigator sets the Forbidden Object before him
CHI looks at the Forbidden Object
CHI huddles close to MOT with his finger in his mouth
INV puts the Forbidden Object away
INV tells MOT about Parent Child Interaction Boxes . CHI gets down from the chair and explores the room
MOT lowers the box to CHI's level
CHI takes the ball out of the box
MOT sits on the floor and sets the box in front of her
MOT opens her arms out to receive the ball
CHI throws the ball into the box
CHI looks at MOT's bag on the floor
MOT takes the ball out of the box
CHI wanders off and looks at MOT bag
CHI pulls the bag away from the chair
MOT holds the ball up for CHI to see
CHI drags the bag out onto the floor
MOT moves forward to stop CHI
MOT puts the bag under the chair
CHI tries to get into the bag
MOT still tries to unwrap the fruit snack
MOT gives CHI a piece of fruit roll-up
CHI reaches for larger piece in MOT's other hand
MOT tries to give CHI a small piece of the fruit
CHI tries to grab the larger piece
CHI watches MOT unwrap the fruit
MOT struggles with the fruit bar
MOT gives CHI some fruit snack
CHI takes the fruit from MOT
MOT takes off another larger piece of fruit and gives it to CHI
MOT walks out of the room
CHI follows MOT out into the hall
MOT speaks with INV in hall and then she and CHI return to the room
MOT holds the ball up for CHI to see
CHI watches MOT bouncing the ball
CHI looks at MOT and smiles
CHI walks near the other chair
MOT rolls the ball to the door
CHI follows the ball and picks it up
MOT takes the ball from CHI
MOT makes the motion of rolling the ball
MOT rolls the ball over to the door again
CHI runs over to the ball and picks it up
CHI brings the ball back to MOT
MOT opens her arms to receive the ball
CHI faces the wall and doesn't look at MOT
MOT throws the ball into the box
CHI takes the ball out of the box
<$=1> MOT taps the ball and looks at CHI
MOT throws the ball into the box
MOT takes the box and covers the ball
CHI sets the box on the ground
CHI looks at MOT and extends his arm towards the ball
<bef> CHI runs after the ball and then stops
MOT puts the ball in the box and turns the box over the ball
CHI goes over to the box
CHI uncovers the ball and drops the box and runs to the other side of the room
MOT stands up holding the ball
CHI stands next to the table
CHI turns and looks at MOT
MOT holds the new activity box out for CHI to see
MOT puts the box on the ground
CHI takes the lid off the box
CHI holds the cloth in his hand and looks at it
MOT covers herself with the cloth
CHI plays with the lid and then starts to go over to MOT
CHI sits on the lid and lifts up the cloth and pulls it off
CHI pulls the cloth off MOT and sits in the box lid
CHI pulls the cloth off his head
MOT covers herself with the cloth
CHI crawls out of the box
CHI pays no attention to MOT
CHI is out of camera view
MOT turns to look at CHI from under the towel
CHI is playing with the wires
MOT pulls CHI away from the socket
MOT prepares to cover her head again
MOT sets the box on the ground
CHI tries to take the lid off
MOT helps CHI open the box
MOT pulls down the box so CHI can open it easily
CHI touches the paper in the box
CHI tips the crayons out of the box
MOT helps CHI tip the crayons out of the box
CHI looks at the paper on the floor
CHI sits back and examines the crayon
CHI looks at the crayon again
CHI pulls on end of crayon
CHI will not take the crayon . CHI plays with small object
CHI gives MOT object he was playing with
CHI lies on his stomach and then squirms around
CHI picks up the lid and closes the box
<aft> MOT looks up at CHI and offers CHI a crayon
CHI draws on the paper briefly and then stops
CHI fidgets around and his pants begin to fall
CHI watches MOT . <aft> CHI leans back and looks at MOT reluctantly
CHI touches the lid of the box
MOT pulls the crayons to her . afterwards MOT draws
CHI tries to take the crayons from MOT's lap
CHI takes the crayons and puts them near the paper
CHI picks up the sheet of paper MOT was drawing on
CHI waves the paper around and then puts it down
MOT draws on the paper CHI just put down
CHI tries to collect all the crayons from MOT's lap
CHI sits back and looks at the crayons he is holding
MOT sits back and looks at CHI
CHI plays with the crayons in his hands
CHI looks at the crayons closely
MOT takes a crayon from CHI
MOT takes more crayons from CHI
End of PCI - Crayons and Paper
CHI stands up and runs out of camera view
CHI is trying to take something down from the table
CHI reaches for the object on the desk
CHI takes an object down from the desk
MOT takes the object from CHI
the object drops on the ground
MOT retrieves the object and puts it back on the desk
CHI tries to take the object from MOT
MOT puts the object on the table
MOT takes CHI by the hand and leads him away
MOT puts the paper and crayons away
CHI stands on a chair next to the table and opens the box
CHI picks up the last box
MOT closes the crayon and paper box
CHI opens the box and throws the lid on the floor
CHI is still standing on the chair
CHI holds the book out to MOT
MOT lifts CHI down from the chair
the bottom of the box falls off the chair
CHI sits on the floor with the book
<bef> MOT puts the box back on the desk
MOT sits with CHI and looks at the book
CHI opens the book and turns the pages
CHI is on all fours looking at book
CHI tries to turn the page
MOT prevents CHI from turning the pages so rapidly
<aft> CHI sits back and looks at the book
MOT looks at CHI for response . MOT points to the picture
CHI rocks back and forth on his knees
MOT points to the picture of the donkey
MOT leans close to CHI and points to the page
CHI points to the desk with boxes on it
MOT takes CHI on her lap and they sit in front of the book
CHI stands up and points to the door
MOT looks down at the book
